definitions.definition: To place in a high location.
definitions.example: Please put up your luggage in the overhead bins.
Many people put up messages on their refrigerators.

definitions.definition: To style (the hair) up on the head instead of letting it hang down.
(with 'to') To cajole or dare to do something.
definitions.example: I think someone put him up to it.
Be sure to put up the tools when you finish.

definitions.definition: To house; to shelter; to take in.
definitions.example: We can put you up for the night.

definitions.definition: To present, especially in "put up a fight".
definitions.example: That last fighter put up quite a fight.

definitions.definition: To endure; to put up with; to tolerate.

definitions.example: Butty Sugrue put up £300,000 for the Ali–Lewis fight.
I put my first child up for adoption.

definitions.definition: (of meat, fruit and vegetables) To can; to process by sterilizing and storing in a bottle or can.
To score; to accumulate scoring. Ellipsis of to put up on the scoreboard.
To stop at an hotel or a tavern for entertainment.
(of an event) Secretly arranged in advance, especially in order to defraud someone or to advance one's own interests.
